BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE LEGAL AID SOCIETY OF ROCHESTER NEW

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: RIGHT OF USE ASSET - OPERATING LEASE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES DEPOSITS OF DISBURSEMENTS, EXPENSES, COSTS, AND OTHER CLIENT MONEY THAT DO NOT BELONG TO THE ORGANIZATION. THE FUNDS ARE MAINTAINED IN INTEREST ON LAWYER ACCOUNT (IOLA) CHECKING ACCOUNTS PURSUANT TO NEW YORK STATE LAW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROVIDES LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO THE POOR AND WORKING POOR THROUGH DIRECT LEGAL REPRESENTATION AND BRIEF LEGAL SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE DIRECT CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES, INCLUDING LAY ADVOCACY AND RELATED HUMAN SERVICES TO ADULTS AND CHILDREN. TO ENSURE THAT THOSE WHO SEEK JUSTICE HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO RECEIVE A FAIR AND FULL HEARING. TO OBTAIN LEGAL SOLUTIONS THAT HAVE A BENEFICIAL IMPACT ON THOSE WHO SEEK OUR SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4A, PROGRAM SERVICE ACCOMPLISHMENT 1:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE LEGAL AID SOCIETY OF ROCHESTER, NY (LASROC) PROVIDES COMPASSIONATE AND HIGH QUALITY CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES, LEGAL COUNSELING, AND TRAINING TO THE MOST VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS IN OUR COMMUNITY. EVERY DOLLAR INVESTED IN LASROC'S SERVICES RETURNS TEN-FOLD BACK TO THE COMMUNITY IN SAVINGS FOR SERVICES SUCH AS SHELTER, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SERVICE PROVIDER COSTS AND COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH FORECLOSURE AND INAPPROPRIATE EVICTIONS. EACH YEAR, LASROC REPRESENTS AN AVERAGE OF 10,500 CHILDREN AND ADULTS, AND TIRELESSLY WORKS TO OBTAIN AN AVERAGE OF $5.8 MILLION DOLLARS IN SAVINGS, CHILD SUPPORT, AND MAINTENANCE FOR OUR CLIENTS. LASROC OPERATES BOTH A CIVIL DIVISION AND A JUVENILE JUSTICE DIVISION. THE CIVIL DIVISION PROVIDES HOLISTIC LEGAL SERVICES THROUGH THE FAMILY LAW, HOUSING AND CONSUMER LAW, EDUCATION LAW, AND IMMIGRATION UNITS. THESE SERVICES ARE PREDOMINANTLY PROVIDED IN MONROE, WAYNE, ORLEANS, GENESEE, LIVINGSTON, STEUBEN AND ONTARIO COUNTIES. THE IMMIGRATION UNIT PROVIDES REPRESENTATION ACROSS NYS, PREDOMINANTLY IN THE 14 CONTIGUOUS COUNTIES SURROUNDING THOSE ENUMERATED ABOVE. THE FAMILY LAW UNIT IS COMMITTED TO COMPASSIONATELY ADVOCATING FOR CLIENTS AS THEY NAVIGATE THE OFTEN OVERWHELMING PROCESSES OF FAMILY COURT AND MATRIMONIAL LITIGATION. OUR FAMILY LAW UNIT ATTORNEYS PROVIDE LEGAL REPRESENTATION IN THE AREAS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, ELDER ABUSE, CUSTODY, VISITATION, DIVORCE SUPPORT, AND OTHER FAMILY LAW MATTERS. THE HOUSING AND CONSUMER LAW UNIT PROVIDES A RANGE OF LEGAL SERVICES AIMED AT THE PROTECTION OF CLIENTS' HOMES AND INCOME, INCLUDING ASSISTANCE WITH SURROGATE COURT FORMS, BANKRUPTCY, CONSUMER CREDIT, DEEDS IN LIEU OF FORECLOSURE, EVICTION, FORECLOSURE PREVENTION, LOAN MODIFICATIONS, REAL ESTATE TRANSACTIONS, AND WILLS, SMITH ESTATES, AND ADVANCED DIRECTIVES. THE IMMIGRATION UNIT PROVIDES LEGAL REPRESENTATION, ADVICE AND INFORMATION TO NON-CITIZEN COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE SERVICES PROVIDED INCLUDE OBTAINING A GREEN CARD, ASYLUM APPLICATIONS, UNITING FAMILIES THROUGH CONSULAR PROCESSING, DEFERRED ACTION FOR CHILDHOOD ARRIVALS, FAMILY-BASED PETITIONS, IMMIGRATION CONSEQUENCES OF CRIMINAL CONVICTIONS, NATURALIZATION/CITIZENSHIP, SPECIAL IMMIGRANT JUVENILE STATUS, T VISAS, TEMPORARY PROTECTED STATUS, U VISAS, VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN ACT PETITIONS, REMOVAL PROCEEDINGS, AND WORK AUTHORIZATION. THE EDUCATION LAW UNIT PROVIDES AN ATTORNEY AND LAY ADVOCATES WHO STRIVE TO ENSURE THAT YOUTH HAVE ACCESS TO APPROPRIATE EDUCATION, PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS FACING LONG-TERM SUSPENSION OR WHO HAVE SPECIAL EDUCATION NEEDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4B, PROGRAM SERVICE ACCOMPLISHMENT 2:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE JUVENILE JUSTICE DIVISION PROVIDES LEGAL REPRESENTATION, ADVOCACY, AND LEGAL COUNSELING TO YOUTH IN MONROE AND STEUBEN COUNTIES. THE ATTORNEY FOR THE CHILD (AFC) UNIT IS PASSIONATELY COMMITTED TO THE CARE AND SAFEGUARDING OF OUR COMMUNITY'S CHILDREN. THESE ATTORNEYS ARE APPOINTED BY AN ORDER OF A FAMILY COURT JUDGE TO PROVIDE FREE LEGAL REPRESENTATION TO CHILDREN IN A VARIETY OF CASES, INCLUDING ABUSE, NEGLECT, JUVENILE DELINQUENCY, PERSONS IN NEED OF SUPERVISION (PINS), CUSTODY, AND VISITATIONS. EACH OF OUR ATTORNEYS UTILIZES THEIR EXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE TO COMPASSIONATELY SUPPORT YOUTHS FACING THESE DIFFICULT SITUATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDIT COMMITTEE AND MANAGEMENT FOR APPROVAL BEFORE IT IS FILED. IT IS ALSO PROVIDED TO THE BOARD FOR REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BY OBTAINING DISCLOSURE FORMS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO DOES AN ANNUAL SELF EVALUATION BASED ON GOALS AND OBJECTIVES APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE ANNUAL REVIEW AND THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES ARE PROVIDED TO THE BOARD COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE MEETS WITH THE CEO TO REVIEW THE ANNUAL REPORT. THE COMMITTEE USES REPORTS FROM COMPENSATION PROFESSIONALS, REVIEWS OTHER FORM 990S, AND REVIEWS LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL COMPENSATION STUDIES. AT THE MARCH BOARD MEETING EACH YEAR, THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REPORTS TO THE FULL BOARD, AND THE FULL BOARD DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO FOR THE YEAR STARTING APRIL 1. IN THIS PROCESS, THE CEO PROVIDES HER SALARY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR HER MANAGEMENT TEAM. THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE COMPENSATION PROPOSED FOR THE CEOS MANAGEMENT TEAM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE OVERSIGHT PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
